alert.note: Alert for Fresno; Kern; Kings (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 24 at 6:28PM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following counties, Fresno, Kern and Kings. * WHEN...Until 930 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 628 PM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bakersfield, Wasco, Avenal, Coalinga, Taft, Maricopa, McKittrick, Derby Acres, Tupman, Valley Acres, Ford City, Dustin Acres, Taft Heights, South Taft, Blackwells Corner, Lost Hills, Belridge, Twisselman, Kettleman City and Kettleman Hills. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
